CSL_Ecc_AggrErrorInfo Struct Reference
ECC Aggregator (ECC_AGGR) » ECC_AGGR Data Structures

This structure contains error status information returned by the CSL_ecc_aggrGetEccRamGetErrorStatus function, and error forcing information used by the CSL_ecc_aggrForceEccRamError function. More...

#include <csl_ecc_aggr.h>

Data Fields

CSL_Ecc_AggrIntrSrc intrSrc
 
bool bOneShotMode
 
uint32_t eccRow

uint32_t eccBit2
 
bool bNextRow
 

Detailed Description

This structure contains error status information returned by the CSL_ecc_aggrGetEccRamGetErrorStatus function, and error forcing information used by the CSL_ecc_aggrForceEccRamError function.

Field Documentation

bool CSL_Ecc_AggrErrorInfo::bNextRow

Error status: Not used. Error forcing: Force single or double-bit error on the next RAM row (the eccRow field is ignored).

bool CSL_Ecc_AggrErrorInfo::bOneShotMode

Error status: Not used. Error forcing: If true, the force_sec/force_ded will inject an error to the specified row only once.

uint32_t CSL_Ecc_AggrErrorInfo::eccBit1

Error status: Indicates the data bit that is in error. Error forcing: Bit position of SEC or 1st bit position for DED

uint32_t CSL_Ecc_AggrErrorInfo::eccBit2

Error status: Not used. Error forcing: 2nd bit position for DED.

uint32_t CSL_Ecc_AggrErrorInfo::eccRow

Error status: Indicates the row/address where the error occurred. Error forcing: Row address where SEC or DED needs to be applied (ignored if bNextRow is true).

CSL_Ecc_AggrIntrSrc CSL_Ecc_AggrErrorInfo::intrSrc

Identifies the interrupt source (CSL_ECC_AGGR_INTR_SRC_SINGLE_BIT, CSL_ECC_AGGR_INTR_SRC_DOUBLE_BIT, or CSL_ECC_ADDR_ERROR_TYPE_SUCCESSIVE_SINGLE_BITS)
